data.author: Reuters
data.title: G7 leaders agree on trying to secure stability in energy markets amid Ukraine crisis
data.description: G7 leaders agreed on Thursday to intensify efforts to mitigate any spillover effects from Russia’s actions against Ukraine and to secure stability in global energy markets, the White House said in a statement released after U.S. President Joe Biden’s meeting with the leaders. (Reporting by Kanishka Singh in Bengaluru Editing by Chris Reese)

data.author: Reuters
data.title: Gold, palladium jump after Russia attacks Ukraine
data.description: Gold hit a more than one-and-half year high on Thursday as investors sought cover in the safe-haven metal after Russia invaded Ukraine, aggravating supply risks to palladium and powering prices of the autocatalyst to a seven-month high. Spot gold was up 1% at $1,926.51 per ounce at 1:31 pm ET (1831 GMT), having earlier touched […]

data.title: Insufficient fuel caused Quorum Aviation crash, says AIB-N
data.description: The Accident Investigation Bureau, Nigeria ( AIB-N) has released a report on the crash of Quorum Aviation’s Bell 206 helicopter, 5N- BQW which went down at Opebi, Lagos and claimed the lives of all crew onboard in August 2020. The AIB-N said the crash was caused by insufficient fuel in the aircraft to sustain the […]
